turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: Nifty, huh?  Goodnight Sweet Prince, parting is . . . inevitable  Now, destroy Superman.

turns.speaker: NUCLEAR MAN
turns.text: First, I have fun.

turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: Nice bit. You're good. With my brain and your, well, frankly, brawn, the possibilities  are staggering. I could be . . . Emperor, King! Did you see how scared those guys were?

turns.speaker: NUCLEAR MAN
turns.text: What do you fear?

turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: Me? Now? With Superman dead and you on my team? It's like I'm the coach and you're the best power forward ever. What could I have to fear?

turns.speaker: NUCLEAR MAN
turns.text: Destiny.

turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: Stop! I command you . . . you mutant!

turns.speaker: NUCLEAR MAN
turns.text: I am master now.

turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: Guess who? It's your old friend, Lex.

turns.speaker: SUPERMAN
turns.text: Luthor, I suspect if you had actually planted a bomb you'd be far away from here by now.

turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: Silly me. How do I ever think I can fool the super guy. You're right, no bomb. I just knew you were too busy with the world peace bit to make a social call.  I confess . . . I tricked you. Hey, you look great!

turns.speaker: SUPERMAN
turns.text: If you have any social skills, you've learned them from a rattlesnake. Just what are you up to?

turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: Know something? You're a workaholic. A good guy 24 hours a day. Stop and smell the roses sometime. Take up a hobby. Get a pet . . . a kitten or a puppy. . .

turns.speaker: SUPERMAN
turns.text: It's common knowledge you hate children and animals. Why are you back in Metropolis?

turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: Why? Because I want to be the first one to introduce you to a new kid on the block.

turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: Look closely at his cell structure. See anything familiar?

turns.speaker: SUPERMAN
turns.text: You've broken all the laws of man, Luthor. And now you've broken the laws of nature! . . .  I assume you must have hidden a device in one of the missiles I hurled into the sun!

turns.speaker: SUPERMAN
turns.text: Your time in prison has twisted you into a delusionary state, Luthor.

turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: No, no, listen. I escaped with only one thing on my mind . . . the end of Superman.

turns.speaker: SUPERMAN
turns.text: I'm not going anywhere.

turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: I'll ignore that . . . So, I created a monster who didn't work nearly as well as I might have liked -- you were clearly his better  --  he needed more energy, more power.

turns.speaker: SUPERMAN
turns.text: Which explains why you sent his organic matter to the sun.

turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: Precisely. And then it came to me. My greatest ever plan. I made a deal with some minor league Bad Boys. Arms Dealers, Renegades Generals, You know the type. With you gone, we'll make a fortune rearming the world.

turns.speaker: SUPERMAN
turns.text: You'd risk worldwide nuclear war for your own personal financial gains.

turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: Nobody wants war. I'd just like to keep the threat alive.

turns.speaker: SUPERMAN
turns.text: A mind is a terrible thing to waste, Lex Luthor. And you've wasted yours on this foul monstrosity. I'm taking you in.

turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: Superman. . .  But you're... dead!

turns.speaker: SUPERMAN
turns.text: Still having delusions, Lex Luthor?

turns.speaker: SUPERMAN
turns.text: I'll deal with you later.

turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: Right, good. Tell you what, we'll wait right here. Till you get back.

turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: But . . . how could you beat him?

turns.speaker: SUPERMAN
turns.text: High School Physics, Luthor. While I was recuperating I had time to figure out that if your foul creature was born from the sun, it must have been his source of energy.

turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: But . . . but isn't the world about to be osterized?

turns.speaker: SUPERMAN
turns.text: No . . . it's the way it always is . . . on the brink . . . with good fighting evil.

turns.speaker: ALBERT
turns.text: I know, but  --

turns.speaker: LUTHOR
turns.text: Stop saying you know when I say 'y'know.' I know you know.  Yes, I know you're here, Otis. What do you want, a brass band?

turns.speaker: LUTHOR
turns.text: You'll be designing monuments soon, Albert! Hotels! Palaces!

turns.speaker: ALBERT
turns.text: Bunkers!

turns.speaker: LUTHOR
turns.text: I take the man out of Argentina - and it was no picnic finding him y'know? And what does he think about? Bunkers. Still living in the past, when I am about to realize the greatest real estate scheme in the history of the world!

turns.speaker: ALBERT
turns.text: There's some slice American cheese...and...a half a bottle of club soda, I think.

turns.speaker: LUTHOR
turns.text: Wonderful. Otis will go above and steal some Big Macs.

turns.speaker: LUTHOR
turns.text: Ahhhh, my favorite part of the day. Who else could have thought of this aquarium?

turns.speaker: ALBERT
turns.text: Nobody else.

turns.speaker: LUTHOR
turns.text: Shut up, apple-polisher.

turns.speaker: LUTHOR
turns.text: That the planet blew up on May 23, 1937. That the rocket ship with the revolting little freak in it took three years to reach Earth. Ergo?

turns.speaker: ALBERT
turns.text: He's thirty-five years old.

turns.speaker: LUTHOR
turns.text: You're a great architect, Albert.

turns.speaker: ALBERT
turns.text: Thank you.

turns.speaker: LUTHOR
turns.text: Otherwise, you're a Mongoloid idiot.  It's reasonable to assume that fragments of the planet were shot out into space by the force of the explosion, and  --

turns.speaker: LUTHOR
turns.text: Ah! The guest of honor at last! And about time, too!

turns.speaker: ALBERT
turns.text: We're running out of smoke.

turns.speaker: ALBERT
turns.text: But Mr. Luthor, sir, I already  --

turns.speaker: LUTHOR
turns.text: And stop interrupting. his is the big scene.  Your finest hour! You rose to the challenge, baby! And you lost. That's the best part!

turns.speaker: ALBERT
turns.text: It's very simple, Otis.  Very simple, the XK101 rocket. It's nothing, forty years ago we in the Fatherland were working on this. Five more years, we would've had it. But then  --  --  that silly war...Why, my cousin Werner had already  --

turns.speaker: LUTHOR
turns.text: Albert!

turns.speaker: ALBERT
turns.text: --  thought about a rocket that carries a nuclear warhead in its nosecone and can strike with an impact of  --

turns.speaker: ALBERT
turns.text: Yes, so, well, Werner would've gotten to that too but  --  --  but the XK101 flies only eight feet above the ground...well below the radar limit!  So what? We could have done that soon. We had ways to make people ta-- ways to avoid the radar. And this XK101  -- they think it's so smart that they keep it in 'missile silos' underground. Hah!  We kept many things underground.

turns.speaker: LUTHOR
turns.text: One of them should've been you.

turns.speaker: ALBERT
turns.text: Yes, Mr. Luthor. The XK101 can travel anywhere in the world undetected. It also has a sensory device built into it so that it can detect any obstacle in its path and avoid it. It just goes around it or over it.  The XK101 never quits! It will not stop until it reaches its pre-targeted target!

turns.speaker: LUTHOR
turns.text: Got it? Otis?

turns.speaker: ALBERT
turns.text: Me?

turns.speaker: LUTHOR
turns.text: Not you.  You.  Tell me again.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: You'd better get a new alarm clock. The chief has been hollering for you.

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: I've been on the job.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: A hot story, huh?

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: It was hot, yes.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: You and Lois, you get all the action.  There she is, out in the wild West and everything.

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: Lois isn't here?

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: She's in California. That's wild enough, I guess.

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: What's she doing in California?

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: It's for that piece she's doing on women and competition. She's off to the Women's Western Golf Classic.

turns.speaker: MARTHA
turns.text: Clark...Son...that...thing you did with the Sheriff today... those...stunts...you don't do those things at school, do you?

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: No, Mom. You know I wouldn't break my promise.

turns.speaker: MARTHA
turns.text: I know you're a good boy, Clark. No mother could ask for better. It's just that...

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: Don't worry, Mom. I know.

turns.speaker: MARTHA
turns.text: Anyway, we Kent's don't like showoffs, ain't that so? A body's got to be humble even if he knows that he's better'n his neighbors.

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: Mom...

turns.speaker: MARTHA
turns.text: I know.

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: I talked to Ben Hubbard this morning. He'll be more than glad to bring in the crops on shares.

turns.speaker: MARTHA
turns.text: He's a good man, Ben is. Your father always said so.

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: Mother...

turns.speaker: MARTHA
turns.text: I know son, I know...

turns.speaker: MARTHA
turns.text: Do you know where you're headed?

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: North. It's north

turns.speaker: MARTHA
turns.text: Keep warm now.

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: I will.

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: I'd like to.

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: Well!

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: I'll bet you have some good ideas.

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: Hey, you're getting a better class of people in your office these days, Boss.

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: Your bookie?

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: I know. He sends a check every week to his dear gray-haired old mother.

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: Actually, she's silver-haired.

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: Not...gray.

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: Not really, no.

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: Are there any more at home like you?

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: Not really, no.

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: Well, how are you enjoying your first day on the job?

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: I think I lost a week's salary at the dart board.

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: Some people aren't the athletic type.

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: But otherwise it's swell.

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: 'Swell.' When  was the last time I heard anybody say  -  where are you from , anyway?

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: See? Didn't I tell you this was a tough town?

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: Unbelievable.

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: Not in Metropolis it isn't. This is the home of the sneak attack, the stab in the back, the --

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: Hey!

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: What the  --  !

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: Stop him, Clark!

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: He may have a gun!

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: Oh, for God's sake!

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: It isn't worth getting a heart attack over, Lois.

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: You're great with the advice, Clark. Maybe you'd better take over the lovelorn column.

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: Supposing that man had hurt you? Is it worth risking your life over ten dollars, two credit cards, and a lipstick? I mean, it's not as if --

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: Know what?

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: You described the exact contents of my purse.

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: I just took a shot at it.

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: What now, my love?

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: Huh?

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: Big night coming up?

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: Oh, not really. I guess I'll just watch a little TV and --  --  unless...would you be interested in dinner?

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: Thanks, Clark, but I'm booked for the night.

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: Oh.

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: It's not what you think. Darn it. I'm going out on a story. The Secretary of Defense is landing at the airport tonight and this kid's going to be there to make sure he answers a few questions he'd rather duck.

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: Don't you ever give up?

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: For what? Oh, I've see the way the other half lives. My sister, for instance. it looks terrific, but is that what I really want? Three kids, two cats, and fifteen needlepoint pillows? I'd go bananas after one week. Hell, I need this crazy existence of mine.  Like I need the plague, right? That's what your thinking.

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: No. I'm just thinking that you smoke too much, if you don't mind my saying so.

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: There's no real proof that tobacco  --

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: Lois, you should see what the inside of your lungs look like.

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: Can I take you to the airport?

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: Not unless you can fly.

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: Come again?

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: I'm telling you, I was there.

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: You were probably so scared you didn't look to see what the trick was.

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: It wasn't a trick!

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: Oh sure. A man flies in the sky like a pigeon and it wasn't a trick.

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: Clark Kent, if you had only seen it the way I did, you -

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: It was done with wires. They must have rigged him like they do with Peter Pan.

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: There weren't any wires. I looked.

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: Mirrors, then. It's done with mirrors.

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: He grabbed me! He held me! He set me down gently! How could that be done with mirrors?

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: Look, there was probably a trampoline on the roof somewhere and this joker just took a big bounce.

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: Why would he do that? How would he know I was going to suddenly slip.

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: I don't know, Lois, but I do know a fraud when I hear one. This thing goes against all natural laws.

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: You're just jealous.

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: Jealous? Of what?

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: Of this...Superman.

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: What'd you call him?

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: Superman.  Pretty good name for him, isn't it?

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: Is that what they're calling him?

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: They will once I hang it on him in tomorrow's edition.

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: Super...man. Hmmm...

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: It isn't that I still don't like you, Clark. It's just that...well, once you've had something like that happen to you, it kind of changes a girl.  I'm going to make some coffee. You want some?

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: No thanks.

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: Oh, what a chance! If I could just  --  get to him.

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: You're not the only one.

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: Yes, but I'm the only one who knows him. I  --  I really like the guy. And he likes me.  I think. I mean, I could talk to him, you know? And he could talk to me.  Anytime...

turns.speaker: SUPERMAN
turns.text: Listen...thank you.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: You too.  I just...I can't get it on for good guys. Y'know?

turns.speaker: SUPERMAN
turns.text: You! The girl from the volcano!  Kryptonite...

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Help! I mean  --  I can't stop saying it. Silly, isn't it  -  There's nothing to worry about. Help! See.

turns.speaker: SUPERMAN
turns.text: What are you doing here?

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Screaming

turns.speaker: SUPERMAN
turns.text: Besides that.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: He wants to see you. Lex Luthor.

turns.speaker: SUPERMAN
turns.text: The bald man! The one who tried to kill me?

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: The way you describe him doesn't really do him justice.

turns.speaker: SUPERMAN
turns.text: I'd better get you down.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Couldn't we forget the plane? You could lift me in your big strong arms?

turns.speaker: SUPERMAN
turns.text: Sure, and let the plane crash in the middle of the city.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Oh.

turns.speaker: SUPERMAN
turns.text: Look, lady, you saved my life once. I owe you a favor. But I can't understand why you follow a man like that.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: What can I tell you? He's my leader.

turns.speaker: SUPERMAN
turns.text: Okay.  Take me to your leader.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: You and your real estate.

turns.speaker: LUTHOR
turns.text: Me and my real estate? How  many other girls, Miss Teschmacher, are lucky enough to have a Park Avenue address like this?

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: It isn't a Park Avenue address. really.

turns.speaker: LUTHOR
turns.text: So it's six hundred feet below Park Avenue, It's still a Park Avenue address.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Why does it all mean so much to you? All the time, 'land, land, land.'

turns.speaker: LUTHOR
turns.text: My father always said to me, 'Son, don't invest your money in anything but land. Land! Stocks rise and fall, banks fall, people are no damn good, but they'll always need land and for that they'll pay through the nose. 'Remember that ,' my father said. 'Land."

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Your father was a sick weirdo.

turns.speaker: LUTHOR
turns.text: I know that. Bu tin this case he was right. Arnold 'Buster' Luthor, the most inept check forger of his time --  A pity he didn't live to see his son strike out for the big city. A pity he didn't live to see how, from humble beginnings, I created an empire.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: This??

turns.speaker: LUTHOR
turns.text: Compared to what came before? A year of living in the sewers?  A part of that will always be with me.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: So I've noticed.

turns.speaker: LUTHOR
turns.text: Criers and complainers! That's what I get! Moaners and groaners! Me, Lex Luthor, who figured out how to live in luxury without ever paying one cent in taxes. Lex Luthor, who built this fantastic kingdom under the sea, so to speak, hidden and undetected by the fools who eke out their miserable lives on the streets above.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Streets, Sunlight. When was the last time I saw sunlight.

turns.speaker: LUTHOR
turns.text: You'll be seeing stars in a minute, Miss Teschmacher. y'know?

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Even that would be an improvement.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Speaking of feeding things, what about dinner?

turns.speaker: LUTHOR
turns.text: What about dinner? I have to worry about the crime of the century, that's all. Y'know? Am I supposed to worry about what's in the refrigerator, too?  What's in it?

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Again???

turns.speaker: LUTHOR
turns.text: First the pets, Otis.

turns.speaker: LUTHOR
turns.text: I needed this, Y'know? I really needed this. just when I'm nearing the fruition of my project, Big Bird flies into town.  Go ahead! Kill me by inches! Put me on the agony rack!

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: You think he's for real?

turns.speaker: LUTHOR
turns.text: He's from another world.

turns.speaker: LUTHOR
turns.text: Nuts. He made it.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Tough guy, huh?

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Bet he makes it.

turns.speaker: LUTHOR
turns.text: You're on.

turns.speaker: LUTHOR
turns.text: Shut up.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: I didn't say a word.

turns.speaker: LUTHOR
turns.text: Damn!  This will get him.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Place your bets, ladies and gentlemen.,

turns.speaker: LUTHOR
turns.text: What's the temperature now?

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Fifty degrees below and still falling.

turns.speaker: LUTHOR
turns.text: When it gets to seventy-five below, stabilize it.

turns.speaker: LUTHOR
turns.text: Krypton!

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Krypton? The place where Superman comes from?

turns.speaker: LUTHOR
turns.text: Some people can read 'War and Peace' and come away thinking it was a simple adventure story. Other people can read the ingredients on a chewing gum wrapper and come away with the secret of the universe.  Y'know.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: I read the article.

turns.speaker: LUTHOR
turns.text: Exactly, Miss Teschmacher.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: See?

turns.speaker: LUTHOR
turns.text: See? I see. It's you who don't see. Doesn't see. I cannot believe it! How you people fail to grasp the long-range significance of this! Y'know?

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: I'm going to bed.

turns.speaker: LUTHOR
turns.text: Stay and listen!  Besides, it's twelve in the afternoon. This is no time to go to bed.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Mr. Romance...

turns.speaker: LUTHOR
turns.text: Deductive reasoning, my friends! That's the name of the game. What does it say here?

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Meteorites!

turns.speaker: LUTHOR
turns.text: Bingo!

turns.speaker: LUTHOR
turns.text: Ahh. 'National Geographic." In my day, this made 'Playboy" look like Mother Goose.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: I don't mean to denigrate your misspent youth, Lex, but what does that rock have to do with --

turns.speaker: LUTHOR
turns.text: Tune me in , lady. An explosion such as the one Superman describes would have altered the molecular structure of the Krypton rock.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: I know I'm going to get rapped in the mouth for saying this, but so what?

turns.speaker: LUTHOR
turns.text: No, you're going to get kissed,

turns.speaker: LUTHOR
turns.text: Breathe that air, Miss Teschmacher.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: I will as soon as I get the sand out of my nose.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: You're happy, aren't you?

turns.speaker: LUTHOR
turns.text: La de da da...

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: You're not going to tell us why you're happy, are you?

turns.speaker: LUTHOR
turns.text: The door jam, Miss Teschmacher. This Ethiopian shmendrick here, in his simple, unconscious way, needed something to wedge the door open, the better to inhale the flies that form such an  important part of his diet. So he grabs something from the table...

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: We just take it?

turns.speaker: LUTHOR
turns.text: What do you suggest, my dear?

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: The least we can do is leave him another door jam.

turns.speaker: LUTHOR
turns.text: About Vesuvius. About Superman writhing in the bowels of the volcano.  Ahh, the look on his face when he saw that Kryptonite. When will I see another, y'know? Y'know?

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: I don't like to talk about it, Lex.

turns.speaker: LUTHOR
turns.text: Weak sister.  I still can't figure out why it took so long for you to catch up with us after we all ran out. Y'know?

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: You ever try to run in high heels?  You probably did.

turns.speaker: LUTHOR
turns.text: Is that an innuendo, Miss Teschmacher? Because if it is, you are about to experience the heady thrill of being hurled from a moving vehicle.

turns.speaker: LUTHOR
turns.text: Ready?

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Ready.

turns.speaker: LUTHOR
turns.text: They stop for nothing.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: But if I put my leg out like Claudette Clobert in  --

turns.speaker: LUTHOR
turns.text: Nothing.

turns.speaker: LUTHOR
turns.text: Don't let me down.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: You?! How about me?

turns.speaker: LUTHOR
turns.text: You have two minutes and thirty- two seconds.

turns.speaker: LUTHOR
turns.text: No news is not good news. Y'know

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: There was a recipe on the back  --

turns.speaker: LUTHOR
turns.text: Something you can feed the pets, perhaps?  Let's have it.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: You're not going to hit me?

turns.speaker: LUTHOR
turns.text: Hit you? A clever girl like you?  'He turned slowly, slowly in the lava...' was how you described it. Now that's clever.  I have to hand it to you.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: I knew you'd hit me.

turns.speaker: LUTHOR
turns.text: You've been under such a strain. And I've ...I've --  -- neglected you. Mea culpa! Y'know.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: I know...

turns.speaker: LUTHOR
turns.text: She knows. Clever, very clever.  And unappreciated. But I'm going to take you away from all this.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: A night on the town instead of under it?

turns.speaker: LUTHOR
turns.text: Baby -- I'm going to take you higher.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: I don't understand.

turns.speaker: LUTHOR
turns.text: Yours not to reason why, Miss Teschmacher. Relax! Enjoy it!  Just look at that smog!

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: This all has something to do with Superman, doesn't it?

turns.speaker: LUTHOR
turns.text: Your volcano chum? Your junior life-saving buddy?  Let's get high.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: I didn't bring any  --

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Oh. Why? does he live up here?

turns.speaker: LUTHOR
turns.text: Not exactly. But it's his kind of neighborhood.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: What are you going to do to him?

turns.speaker: LUTHOR
turns.text: Nothing, nothing. I just want to invite him to tea.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Tea?

turns.speaker: LUTHOR
turns.text: You got wax in your ears?

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: What if he doesn't show up? What if he's taking a nap?

turns.speaker: LUTHOR
turns.text: He always shows up when somebody's in danger.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Danger??  Somebody??? Lex  -- where are you going?

turns.speaker: LUTHOR
turns.text: Lex is going bye-bye.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Where's mine?! Where's my parachute?

turns.speaker: LUTHOR
turns.text: Miss Teschmacher, Superman is a fairly bright individual. My understanding of the way he works is that he won't be fooled by a simple trick.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Good. Fine. Now where's my parachute?

turns.speaker: LUTHOR
turns.text: I'm wearing it.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: I mean the other one!

turns.speaker: LUTHOR
turns.text: What other one?

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: You can't do this to me!

turns.speaker: LUTHOR
turns.text: Of course I can. I love you.

turns.speaker: JOR-EL
turns.text: But you can't ignore these facts!  It's suicide!  Worse than that, it's genocide.

turns.speaker: FIRST ELDER
turns.text: Jor-El, Be warned. This tone of yours approaches insolence.

turns.speaker: JOR-EL
turns.text: My friends, I am not a rash, impulsive person. I'm not given to wild, unsupported 	statements. We must evacuate this planet immediately!

turns.speaker: FIRST ELDER
turns.text: You are one of Krypton's greatest scientists Jor-El -

turns.speaker: JOR-EL
turns.text: Then -

turns.speaker: FIRST ELDER
turns.text: But so is Vond-El

turns.speaker: JOR-EL
turns.text: I have sworn to uphold the laws of Krypton.

turns.speaker: FIRST ELDER
turns.text: This discussion is terminated. The decision of the council is final.  You will cease pursuing this matter. Any attempt by you to continue, to create a climate of fear and panic among the populace, will be deemed an act of insurrection!

turns.speaker: JOR-EL
turns.text: And if I don't obey?

turns.speaker: JOR-EL
turns.text: As an irredeemable criminal? You compare me to them?

turns.speaker: FIRST ELDER
turns.text: If you persist, you leave us no choice.

turns.speaker: FIRST ELDER
turns.text: Will you abide by the Council's opinion?

turns.speaker: JOR-EL
turns.text: Neither my wife nor I will attempt to leave Krypton.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: What're you writing, Lois?

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: an Ode to Spring. are there one or two "T's" in bloodletting?

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Two.

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: 'And the people on the street, the little man who runs the corner newsstand, the old lady sunning herself on the stoop the kids playing stick ball -- none of them will ever forget the night of senseless bloodletting that turned a friendly block part into a nightmare.'

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Boy!

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: Gets you where you live, huh?

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: How come you get all the good stories, Lois?

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: It's because I'm an intrepid girl reporter, Jimmy.  Besides, the chief of detectives has the hots for me.

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: Need I ask who's favored to collect at the end of this week.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: On the salary he pays me, I can't make my rent without it.

turns.speaker: MARTHA
turns.text: It's a ...baby.

turns.speaker: JONATHAN
turns.text: What's your name, boy?

turns.speaker: MARTHA
turns.text: Don't just stand there gapin' Jonathan. Can't you see he's cold?

turns.speaker: JONATHAN
turns.text: Well - gotta change that tire if were gonna get home.

turns.speaker: MARTHA
turns.text: All of us.

turns.speaker: MARTHA
turns.text: The good lord works in mysterious ways.

turns.speaker: JONATHAN
turns.text: He sure as heck does that.

turns.speaker: MARTHA
turns.text: All these years, happy as we've been, how I prayed and prayed He'd see fit to give us a child. And just when I finally accepted my bitter lot...  No one must ever know.

turns.speaker: JONATHAN
turns.text: Folks'll ask question.

turns.speaker: MARTHA
turns.text: We'll say he's a child to my cousin in North Dakota, and just now orphaned.  Poor thing.

turns.speaker: JONATHAN
turns.text: Guess I'd better hitch up the rig and come back to get that...that thing he was settin' in. What do you make of that thing? Martha? You listening?

turns.speaker: MARTHA
turns.text: I was thinkin' what to call him. I was thinkin' I had an uncle who was a fine man, you recall him? The Church Sexton

turns.speaker: JONATHAN
turns.text: Who? Clark? I never cared two hoots for that fella.  Jonathan Jr. That's got a ring to it.

turns.speaker: MARTHA
turns.text: We don't want a child called 'Junior,' ain't that so, Clark? Why sure it is.

turns.speaker: JONATHAN
turns.text: Got all A's this year. Teacher said he's the best 5th grader in the -

turns.speaker: MARTHA
turns.text: Don't brag now,  Jonathan.

turns.speaker: MARTHA
turns.text: Oh, dear. That isn't what I --

turns.speaker: JONATHAN
turns.text: What your mother means, Clark, is that she don't want folks to think you're special.

turns.speaker: MARTHA
turns.text: I bless the day you came to us, son. You know that. But some people wouldn't understand.

turns.speaker: JOR-EL
turns.text: It's the only logical conclusion. If he remains here, he'll be as dead as...

turns.speaker: LARA
turns.text: -- as we will be.

turns.speaker: JOR-EL
turns.text: Lara, please...

turns.speaker: LARA
turns.text: But why Earth, Jor-El. They're practically animals.

turns.speaker: JOR-EL
turns.text: They are primitive, Lara, but they are not animals.

turns.speaker: LARA
turns.text: A million years behind us.  Jor-El, he's only a baby.

turns.speaker: JOR-EL
turns.text: Their atmosphere will sustain him. He will look like one of them.

turns.speaker: LARA
turns.text: He'll be weightless.

turns.speaker: JOR-EL
turns.text: Yes, true. But on other worlds there would be other problems - heat, cold, no life, no life support systems...No, Lara, believe me; Earth is the least of evils. On Earth, his lighter gravity will render him almost weightless - that can't be helped. But with his denser molecular structure, he will also be strong.  He will be fast, He will be virtually invulnerable.

turns.speaker: LARA
turns.text: He will be odd, different.

turns.speaker: JOR-EL
turns.text: Well, physiologically, he...	won't quite fit.

turns.speaker: JOR-EL
turns.text: You've been doing some research in the archives.

turns.speaker: LARA
turns.text: I want to know what my child is going to face.

turns.speaker: JOR-EL
turns.text: Then you have on of those 'feelings.' It was called: 'love.'

turns.speaker: SUPERMAN
turns.text: I don't know what to say.  Look, I -- I just -

turns.speaker: JOR-EL
turns.text: Enjoyed it?

turns.speaker: SUPERMAN
turns.text: I guess I got carried away

turns.speaker: JOR-EL
turns.text: My son, I foresaw this. I knew -

turns.speaker: SUPERMAN
turns.text: No! You couldn't imagine -

turns.speaker: JOR-EL
turns.text: How good it felt!

turns.speaker: SUPERMAN
turns.text: How good it felt -

turns.speaker: JOR-EL
turns.text: ....to feel yourself. Very well. You are revealed to the world. But still you must keep your secret identity. First of all, you will need it as an escape valve. You cannot be special twenty-eight hours a day -

turns.speaker: SUPERMAN
turns.text: Twenty-four.

turns.speaker: JOR-EL
turns.text: Or twenty-four as it is in Earth time. Furthermore, if you will reveal yourself, your enemies will have a way of getting at you where you are vulnerable: by hurting the people you care for.  Ah, this Earth...this world you live in, Kal-El...  Resist its temptations, its rewards, especially its political system.

turns.speaker: SUPERMAN
turns.text: There are none of them any good anyway.

turns.speaker: JOR-EL
turns.text: And it is forbidden for you to interfere with human history. All you can do, Kal-El, even now that you have...found yourself...is help them to evolve. Set an example. Show them they must strive towards the light. And... remember us...

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: Here's the story on that East 19th Street murder spree. Page one with a banner headline seems about right to me.

turns.speaker: PERRY
turns.text: It does, huh?  Clark Kent, I'd like you to meet Lois Lane.

turns.speaker: PERRY
turns.text: Lois, take Kent there and introduce him around

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: Okay, but...why?  No offense.

turns.speaker: PERRY
turns.text: Lois, the kickback story...

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: Nine to five it's a Pulitzer Prize, I know.

turns.speaker: PERRY
turns.text: I was going to say that there's only one 'p' in subpoena. What the hell did you major in at Radcliffe? Middle English?  Nice job on the teamster's update, Kent.
